ygData.subject: Re: Why do they want Bronze?
ygData.msgSnippet: You are a type B person :)  type B people get lucky and occasionally find good looking items with nice stats :) ... From: Nosferatu
ygData.messageBody:
You are a type B person :) type B people get lucky and occasionally find good looking items with nice stats :)

>>> Nosferatu <nosferatu@...> 7.13.99 9:52:50 AM >>>
From: Nosferatu <nosferatu@...>

You forgot group 3 (which is where I fall in) which is will ditch a bit
of ac for looks, but I do care about the AC too. or if I can get both,
Happy Day! (heh runed circlet ac 4, has graphic, and plus 4 int and wis!
(sorry am a caster hard to find visible stuff for us =) )
/nos

Jason Coan wrote:
>
> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> Its looks, plain and simple, some people care more about how they look than they do about having the most efficient weight/ac armor ratio.
>
> There are basically 2 types of people. Type A, which cares a great deal about stats and couldn't care a bit about looks. And type B, which care more about looks than stats.
>
> I'm a 36th lvl DE warrior, and I'm definitally a type B person. As soon as I was able, I aquired a full set of blackend iron chainmail. Which is lower AC than banded and A LOT heavier. Sure the weight was annoying, but I looked much cooler than the person standing beside me in full banded. After a couple weeks of wearing full blackend I discovered that small bronze was the same weight but more AC. At which point I decided to get me a full set of bronze, but after seeing countless other people in full sets of bronze I decided I really didn't like that look. But since I was at Unrest I decided to get some anyways. What I ended up with was bronze helm, tunic, bracers, leggings, and still had my blackend arms, gloves, boots. This turned out to be a nice looking combo, so I thought, and I had several other people stop and tell me the same. Now many many levels later, I have Rubicite (red plate) helm, arms, bracers, leggings, and Charred (Black plate) tunic, boots, and gl!
oves,
> weilding a black 2h sword. Charred isn't as good as Rubicite, but the combo of the red and black plate looks extremely impressive.
>
> To each their own, some people care more about an extra point of AC or an extra 2 points of wisdom more than they care how they look. Some will sacrifice a couple AC and a couple points of an attribute so that they can have nicer looking equipment.
>
> --------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------
>
> ONElist: your connection to like-minds and kindred spirits.
>
